Source code for dw

#!/usr/bin/python
"""

This code implements a Lagrangean relaxation scheme for the multi-item
multi-period capacitated lot sizing problem.

"""

import sys, getopt
import math
import cplex
from time import time
import numpy as np
import random
random.seed(27)

_INFTY = sys.float_info.max
#  _EPSI  = sys.float_info.epsilon
maxIter = 20
_EPSI    = 0.00001
bigM     = 1.0e8
nSolInPool =1000000000


[docs]class DantzigWolfe:
    def __init__(self, inp):
        self.l_ilo = [] # master variables
        self.n_ilo = [] # master variables
        self.y_ilo = [] # subproblem variables
        self.z_ilo = [] # subproblem variables

        self.yWW   = []  # Wagner-Within solution
        self.zWW   = []  # Wagner-Within solution

        for j in range(inp.nI):
            self.l_ilo.append([])
            self.n_ilo.append([])
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            self.z_ilo.append([])

        self.cpx   = cplex.Cplex()
        self.cpx.objective.set_sense(self.cpx.objective.sense.minimize)
        self.cpx.set_results_stream(None)
        self.cpx.set_log_stream(None)
        self.define_master(inp)

        u, alpha = self.initialize_multipliers(inp)
        
        #  define subproblem
        self.cpxSub   = cplex.Cplex()
        self.cpxSub.objective.set_sense(self.cpxSub.objective.sense.minimize)
        self.cpxSub.set_results_stream(None)
        self.cpxSub.set_log_stream(None)
        #  define subproblem w/out specifying the item
        self.define_ulsp(inp, self.cpxSub, u, alpha)


[docs]    def get_columns(self, inp, item, u, alpha):
        cpxSub = self.cpxSub
        y_ilo  = self.y_ilo
        z_ilo  = self.z_ilo
        yWW    = self.yWW

        #  add WW constraint to find "dominated" setup plans
        lDominated = []
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            constrName = "dominated." + str(t)
            lDominated.append(constrName)
            sub_contraint = cplex.SparsePair(ind=[y_ilo[t]], val=[1.0])
            cpxSub.linear_constraints.add(lin_expr = [sub_contraint],
                                       senses   = ["L"],
                                       rhs      = [yWW[t]],
                                       names    = [constrName])

        
        rhs = 1 - sum([yWW[t] for t in range(inp.nP)])
        index = [y_ilo[t] for t in range(inp.nP)]
        value = [(1-2*yWW[t]) for t in range(inp.nP)]
        diff_constraint = cplex.SparsePair(ind=index, val=value)
        cpxSub.linear_constraints.add(lin_expr = [diff_constraint],
                                   senses   = ["G"],
                                   rhs      = [rhs],
                                   names    = ["different"])

        #  first, we solve the ULSP, and then we call the populate solution
        #  self.cpxMaster.parameters.mip.tolerances.absmipgap.set()
        self.cpxSub.parameters.mip.tolerances.mipgap.set(0.1)
        cpxSub.solve()
        cpxSub.parameters.mip.pool.intensity.set(4)
        cpxSub.parameters.mip.pool.capacity.set(nSolInPool)
        #  cpxSub.parameters.mip.pool.relgap.set(0.9)
        cpxSub.parameters.mip.limits.populate.set(nSolInPool)
        cpxSub.populate_solution_pool()

        # collecting pool solutions (one of them should be WW)
        names = cpxSub.solution.pool.get_names()
        nPool = len(names)
        print("POOL size = ", nPool)
        #  for n in names:
        #      print("z(",n,") = ", cpxSub.solution.pool.get_objective_value(n))
 
        q     = 1
        for n in names:
            #  rc = cpxSub.solution.pool.get_objective_value(n) - alpha[item]
            self.zWW = []
            for t in range(inp.nP):
                self.zWW.append(cpxSub.solution.get_values(z_ilo[t]))
            self.add_dominated_column_to_master(inp, item, q)
            q += 1

        cpxSub.linear_constraints.delete(lDominated)
        cpxSub.linear_constraints.delete("different")

    

[docs]    def add_dominated_column_to_master(self, inp, item, q):

        cpx       = self.cpx
        lLinking  = self.lLinking
        l_ilo     = self.l_ilo
        n_ilo     = self.n_ilo
        yWW       = self.yWW
        zWW       = self.zWW
        
        nrVars     = len(l_ilo[item])-1
        varName = "mu." + str(item) + "." + str(nrVars) + "." + str(q)
        n_ilo[item][nrVars].append(cpx.variables.get_num())
        coeff = sum([inp.f[item][t] for t in range(inp.nP) if yWW[t] >
                1.0 - _EPSI])
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            for r in range(t+1,inp.nP):
                if zWW[t][r] > _EPSI:
                    coeff += (r-t)*inp.h[item][t]*zWW[t][r]
        cpx.variables.add(obj         = [coeff],
                                lb    = [0],
                                ub    = [1],
                                names = [varName])

        # add variables to the corresponding constraints
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            constrName = "capacity." + str(t)
            if yWW[t] > 1.0 - _EPSI:
                cap = inp.m[item][t] + sum([inp.a[item][t]*zWW[t][r] for r in
                range(t,inp.nP)]) 
            else:
                cap = 0.0
            cpx.linear_constraints.set_coefficients(constrName,
            n_ilo[item][nrVars][q], cap)
        #     cpxMaster.linear_constraints.set_coefficients(zip(constrName, index,
        #     value))

        constrName = "linking." + str(item) + "." + str(nrVars)
        cpx.linear_constraints.set_coefficients(constrName,
        n_ilo[item][nrVars][q], 1.0)

        self.cpx = cpx
        self.n_ilo     = n_ilo

        



[docs]    def column_generation(self, inp, u, alpha):
        cpxSub = self.cpxSub
        stopping = True
        for j in range(inp.nI):
            rc = self.solve_ulsp(inp, cpxSub, u, alpha, j)
            if rc < -0.0001 or self.iterNr <= 1:
                stopping = False
                #  add column to master
                self.add_column_to_master(inp, j, 0)
                self.get_columns(inp, j, u, alpha)

        return stopping





[docs]    def add_column_to_master(self, inp, item, q):

        lLinking = self.lLinking
        l_ilo    = self.l_ilo
        n_ilo    = self.n_ilo
        cpx      = self.cpx
        yWW      = self.yWW
        zWW      = self.zWW

        nrVars   = len(l_ilo[item])
        varName  = "lambda." + str(item) + "." + str(nrVars)
        l_ilo[item].append(cpx.variables.get_num())
        cpx.variables.add(obj   = [0.0],
                          lb    = [0],
                          ub    = [1],
                          names = [varName])

        varName = "mu." + str(item) + "." + str(nrVars) + "." + str(q)
        n_ilo[item].append([])
        n_ilo[item][nrVars].append(cpx.variables.get_num())
        coeff = sum([inp.f[item][t] for t in range(inp.nP) if yWW[t] >
                1.0 - _EPSI])
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            for r in range(t+1,inp.nP):
                if zWW[t][r] > _EPSI:
                    coeff += (r-t)*inp.h[item][t]*zWW[t][r]
        print("coeff for item ", item, " for this plan is = ", coeff)
        cpx.variables.add(obj = [coeff],
            lb                = [0.0],
            ub                = [1.0],
            # types             = ["C"],
            names             = [varName])

        #  add the variables to the constraints
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            constrName = "capacity." + str(t)
            if yWW[t] > 1.0 - _EPSI:
                cap = inp.m[item][t] + sum([inp.a[item][t]*zWW[t][r] for r in
                range(t,inp.nP)]) 
            else:
                cap = 0.0
            cpx.linear_constraints.set_coefficients(constrName,
            n_ilo[item][nrVars][q], cap)

        constrName = "convexity." + str(item)
        cpx.linear_constraints.set_coefficients(constrName,
        l_ilo[item][nrVars],1.0)

        constrName = "linking." + str(item) + "." + str(nrVars)
        index = [n_ilo[item][nrVars][q], l_ilo[item][nrVars]]
        value = [1.0, -1.0]
        linking_constraint = cplex.SparsePair(ind=index, val=value)
        cpx.linear_constraints.add(lin_expr = [linking_constraint],
                                   senses   = ["E"],
                                   rhs      = [0.0],
                                   names    = [constrName])
        lLinking.append(constrName)

        self.lLinking = lLinking
        self.cpx      = cpx
        self.l_ilo    = l_ilo
        self.n_ilo    = n_ilo



[docs]    def get_master_solution(self):
        cpx        = self.cpx
        lCapacity  = self.lCapacity
        lConvexity = self.lConvexity

        u          = cpx.solution.get_dual_values(lCapacity)
        alpha      = cpx.solution.get_dual_values(lConvexity)
        print("MASTER = ", cpx.solution.get_objective_value())

        return u, alpha




[docs]    def define_master(self, inp):
        cpx   = self.cpx
        l_ilo = self.l_ilo
        n_ilo = self.n_ilo
        k     = 0 # column 0 corresponds to high initial inventory

        for j in range(inp.nI):
            varName = "lambda." + str(j) + "." + str(k)
            l_ilo[j].append(cpx.variables.get_num())
            cpx.variables.add(obj   = [0.0],
                              lb    = [0],
                              ub    = [1],
                              # types = ["B"],
                              names = [varName])
            varName = "mu." + str(j) + "." + str(k) + "." + str(0)
            n_ilo[j].append([])
            n_ilo[j][k].append(cpx.variables.get_num())

            cpx.variables.add(obj = [bigM],
                lb                = [0.0],
                ub                = [1.0],
                # types             = ["C"],
                names             = [varName])
        
        #  add constraints and define names
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            constrName = "capacity." + str(t)
            index = []
            value = []
            capacity_constraint = cplex.SparsePair(ind=index, val=value)
            cpx.linear_constraints.add(lin_expr = [capacity_constraint],
                                       senses   = ["L"],
                                       rhs      = [inp.cap[t]],
                                       names    = [constrName])

        for j in range(inp.nI):
            constrName = "convexity." + str(j)
            index = [l_ilo[j][k]]
            value = [1.0]
            convexity_constraint = cplex.SparsePair(ind=index, val=value)
            print(" == ", convexity_constraint)
            cpx.linear_constraints.add(lin_expr = [convexity_constraint],
                                       senses   = ["E"],
                                       rhs      = [1.0],
                                       names    = [constrName])

        for j in range(inp.nI):
            constrName = "linking." + str(j) + "." + str(k)
            index = [n_ilo[j][k][0], l_ilo[j][k]]
            value = [1.0, -1.0]
            linking_constraint = cplex.SparsePair(ind=index, val=value)
            print(" == ", linking_constraint)
            cpx.linear_constraints.add(lin_expr = [linking_constraint],
                                       senses   = ["E"],
                                       rhs      = [0.0],
                                       names    = [constrName])

        #  define labels to access constraints
        lCapacity = ["capacity." + str(t) for t in range(inp.nP)]
        lConvexity = ["convexity." + str(j) for j in range(inp.nI)]
        lLinking = ["linking." + str(j) + "." + str(k) for j in
        range(inp.nI)] 

        self.cpx        = cpx
        self.lCapacity  = lCapacity
        self.lConvexity = lConvexity
        self.lLinking   = lLinking

        

[docs]    def solve_ulsp(self, inp, cpx, u, alpha, item):

        y_ilo = self.y_ilo
        z_ilo = self.z_ilo

        #  change obj function coefficients
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            coeffY = inp.f[item][t] - u[t]*inp.m[item][t]
            cpx.objective.set_linear(y_ilo[t], coeffY)
            for r in range(t, inp.nP):
                coeffZ = inp.h[item][t]*(r-t) - u[t]*inp.a[item][t]
                cpx.objective.set_linear(z_ilo[t][r], coeffZ)

        #  change rhs of demand constraints
        for r in range(inp.nP):
            constrName = "demand." + str(r)
            cpx.linear_constraints.set_rhs(constrName, inp.d[item][r])
        #  change coefficient y variable in logic constraint
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            for r in range(t,inp.nP):
                constrName = "logic." + str(t) + "." + str(r)
                cpx.linear_constraints.set_coefficients(constrName, y_ilo[t],
                -inp.d[item][r])
        #  change coefficient y variable in cumulative logic constraint
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            constrName = "cumLogic." + str(t)
            cpx.linear_constraints.set_coefficients(constrName, y_ilo[t],
            -inp.max_prod[item][t])

        cpx.write("sub" + str(item) + ".lp")
        cpx.solve()

        #  get WW solution
        rc  = cpx.solution.get_objective_value()
        rc -= alpha[item]
        print ("z_ULSP(",item,") = ", rc)


        yWW = [cpx.solution.get_values(y_ilo[t]) for t in range(inp.nP)]
        zWW = []
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            zWW.append(cpx.solution.get_values(z_ilo[t]))

        self.yWW = yWW
        self.zWW = zWW

        return rc



[docs]    def define_ulsp(self, inp, cpx, u, alpha):
        """
        This is the SINGLE ITEM uncapacitated problem.
        """

        y_ilo = self.y_ilo
        z_ilo = self.z_ilo

        #  create variables y_jt (for a fixed j)
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            varName = "y." + str(t)
            y_ilo.append(cpx.variables.get_num())
            cpx.variables.add(obj   = [0.0],
                              lb    = [0],
                              ub    = [1],
                              types = ["B"],
                              names = [varName])

        #  create variables z_jts
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            for r in range(inp.nP):
                varName = "z." + str(t) + "." + str(r)
                z_ilo[t].append(cpx.variables.get_num())
                cpx.variables.add(obj   = [0.0],
                                  lb    = [0.0],
                                  ub    = [cplex.infinity],
                                  types = ["C"],
                                  names = [varName])

        #  demand constraints
        for r in range(inp.nP):
            constrName = "demand." + str(r)
            index = [z_ilo[t][r] for t in range(r+1)]
            value = [1.0]*(r+1)
            demand_constraint = cplex.SparsePair(ind=index, val=value)
            cpx.linear_constraints.add(lin_expr = [demand_constraint],
                                       senses   = ["E"],
                                       rhs      = [0.0],
                                       names    = [constrName])

        #  logic constraints
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            for r in range(t, inp.nP):
                constrName = "logic." + str(t) + "." + str(r)
                index = [z_ilo[t][r], y_ilo[t]]
                #  value = [1.0, -inp.d[j][r]]
                value = [1.0, 0.0]
                logic_constraint = cplex.SparsePair(ind =index, val=value)
                cpx.linear_constraints.add(lin_expr = [logic_constraint],
                                           senses   = ["L"],
                                           rhs      = [0.0],
                                           names    = [constrName])
        #  cumulative logic constraints
        for t in range(inp.nP):
            constrName = "cumLogic." + str(t)
            index = [z_ilo[t][r] for r in range(t,inp.nP)]
            value = [1.0]*(inp.nP-t)
            index += [y_ilo[t]]
            #  value += [-inp.max_prod[j][t]]
            value += [0.0]
            logic_constraint_cum = cplex.SparsePair(ind =index, val=value)
            cpx.linear_constraints.add(lin_expr = [logic_constraint_cum],
                                       senses   = ["L"],
                                       rhs      = [0.0],
                                       names    = [constrName])


        #  set to zero unused variables
        for r in range(inp.nP-1):
            for t in range(r+1, inp.nP):
                cpx.variables.set_upper_bounds(z_ilo[t][r], 0.0)

        self.y_ilo = y_ilo
        self.z_ilo = z_ilo

        


[docs]    def initialize_multipliers(self, inp):
        u     = [0.0]*inp.nP
        alpha = [0.0]*inp.nI

        return u, alpha

        

[docs]    def dw_cycle(self, inp):
        u, alpha = self.initialize_multipliers(inp)
        self.iterNr = 0
        stopping = False
        while stopping == False and self.iterNr < maxIter:
            self.iterNr += 1
            stopping = self.column_generation(inp, u, alpha)
            print("Nr. columns after generation = ", self.cpx.variables.get_num())
            self.cpx.solve() # solve master 
            self.cpx.write("master.lp")
            u, alpha = self.get_master_solution()

        # redefine master as MIP and solve it
        self.cpx.set_problem_type(self.cpx.problem_type.MILP)
        for j in range(inp.nI):
            for k in range(len(self.l_ilo[j])):
                self.cpx.variables.set_types(self.l_ilo[j][k], self.cpx.variables.type.binary)

        self.cpx.write("MIP.lp")
        self.cpx.solve()
        print("MIP = ", self.cpx.solution.get_objective_value())
        for j in range(inp.nI):
            lSol = self.cpx.solution.get_values(self.l_ilo[j])
            print("lambda = ", lSol)
